sen.j: 藤原 薩雄（ふじわら の よしお、生没年不詳）は、奈良時代の官僚。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Yoshio (dates of birth and death unknown) was a bureaucrat during the Nara period.
FUJIWARA no Yoshio (date of birth and death unknown) was a bureaucrat who lived during the Nara period.

sen.e: FUJIWARA no Yoshio (date of birth and death unknown) was a bureaucrat who lived during the Nara period.

sen.j: 藤原仲麻呂の七男（「尊卑分脈」）とされる。
sen.e: He was the seventh son of FUJIWARA no Nakamaro according to (the 'Sonpi Bunmyaku' [a text compiled in the fourteenth century that records the lineages of the aristocracy]).
He was said to be the seventh son of FUJIWARA no Nakamaro ("Sonpi Bunmyaku" [a text compiled in the fourteenth century that records the lineages of the aristocracy]).
He was said to be the seventh son of FUJIWARA no Nakamaro ("Sonpi Bunmyaku" [a text compiled in the fourteenth century that records the lineages of the aristocracy]).

sen.j: 但し、同音異字の兄弟・藤原刷雄と同一人物ではないかとする説がある（詳細は「藤原刷雄」の項参照）。
sen.e: However, it is also said that he was the same person as his brother, FUJIWARA no Yoshio, for his first name Yoshio (薩雄) had the same sound as his brother's Yoshio (刷雄) but different kanji (a detailed discussion of him can be found in the article 'FUJIWARA no Yoshio').

However, there is another theory that he and his brother, whose name is also pronounced as 'FUJIWARA no Yoshio' but a different set of Japanese kanji (刷雄) is used for his given name, might be the same person (For details, see the article 'FUJIWARA no Yoshio [藤原刷雄]').
